item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: sn.ow.y
item.description:
This is a pretty interesting track, and I like it. I do agree that it’s not synthwave, but I get how it’s kinda close. Good job, and good luck working on new projects

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Osharu
item.description:
Regardless of follower count, I’d still try to get another track released under Efflux again. Just have to get the motivation to make another track and to have some more inspiration to make said track.

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Tolberto
item.description:
TL DR efflux did an oopsie and this isn’t synthwave, but good track nonetheless

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Peregrihn
item.description:
Also it’s generally unorthodox for a label to tell the artist how to make something sound and that is a lot of the reason why I skimmed over the feedback. I want you to express your motives and inspiration for the track and wether it fits our vibe as a retrowave label or not is entirely different. I don’t think it’s healthy as an artist to try to conform to a standard for the sole purpose of getting a label release, especially if the label hasn’t even established a sound yet and has a follower count that is nothing to brag about.

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Peregrihn
item.description:
@Osharu I would like to formally apologize because had I payed a little bit more attention to the wording of our feedback given, I would’ve specified that this track needed different compositional techniques to fall into the scope of efflux’s radar from a retrowave stand point. I’ve been kind of absent from the label as I’m working on an album and to really dig into what I see for the label would take more effort that what I have time for with album development. @Mr_Mooo this apology is for you too seeing as you let me be a figure of importance in what was your project. However I do want to help shape efflux into a great retrowave label and push it into the right direction when I get all my affairs in order.

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Osharu
item.description:
Well then. Guess idk how to read, lol

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
peregrihn is a staff member at efflux and helped write that feedback. plus we never told you that the main genre of the song was synthwave

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Osharu
item.description:
I classified it as Synthwave because I spoke to a Synthwave label about potentially releasing it. After months of discussion, they denied it, but said that with a little work on melodies and certain samples, my track could be released by them. Well, since I had spent literal MONTHS trying to get this released under them, I didn’t care anymore, and decided to release it myself. But they had agreed that it was indeed Synthwave, so hence the classification.

TLDR: A Synthwave label (Efflux) told me it was Synthwave

Read full topic

item.title: Light - Osharu [Synthwave]
item.dc:creator: Peregrihn
item.description:
I’m not sure how this qualifies as synthwave, man. I heard you’re use of some of the retrofit track and it’s a good song but I don’t think it fits synthwave. Not trying to be a downer because it’s still a really cool track but idk of Synthwave is the right tag for it, for marketing/promotion purposes

Read full topic
